Job Title: Senior Full Stack Engineer - Test Automation
Job Description:
About the Role

In this role, you’ll develop the next generation of assessments using leading technologies. You’ll work with innovative agile teams using the full stack to solve remote testing security problems.


Responsibilities of the Role

  • Collaborate on software projects with product design and technical teams

  • Develop, test, release, and maintain back-end services, front-end applications, and AWS infrastructure

  • Work as a technical contributor on an Agile team


Qualifications needed for the role

  • BA/BS required (major in an analytical field desired)

  • A minimum of 5 years’ work related experience

  • Advanced experience working with Node.js, AWS, Typescript/Javascript, NoSQL database (Dynamodb)

  • Advance experience in implementing serverless applications on AWS

  • Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment

  • Experience working on Agile engineering teams

  • Experience in doing pair programming with fellow engineers

  • Some experience working in Python


Preferred Skills and Attributes for the Role

  • Ability to perform in multiple roles on a team, including testing and production support as well as development

  • Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving ability

  • Experience using libraries and frameworks where it makes sense, while still understanding how each line in your codebase works

  • Willingness to work on QA and develop test automation scripts and participate in code reviews

  • Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively in a cross-functional team environment

  • Ethos of continuous improvement and interest in learning new things

  • Strong ability to understand and internalize the big picture and broader implications

  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skill with the ability to work with a diverse set of colleagues, across functions, from different organizations, disciplines, etc.

  • Self-starter, ability to set priorities, work independently and attain goals

  • AWS Certified (Associate or higher)

In this role, you will:

  • Develop and implement solutions, based on a set of standards, patterns and processes which establish consistency across the enterprise data, reduce risk, and promote efficiencies in support of the organization’s goals and objectives.

  • Developing full stack AWS Cloud solutions and continuous delivery frameworks that improve the ability of the CB IT delivery teams to efficiently deliver solutions with quality.

  • Write complex code, building infrastructure as code, work with immutable “cloud” based environments, and build the supporting automated toolsets to test and deploy the systems they develop.

  • Responsible for the quality of their work; will develop and implement a set of quality criteria and the associated validation method to ensure that any deliverable meets the expected quality levels of our customers, use quality management to ensure quality levels are maintained, seek new approaches and techniques to improve quality levels, employ reviews and observations to maintain the quality and continuous improvement process, and analyze the impact of quality control and quality assurance on project performance.

  • Actively review their own and the team’s work processes and implements improvements seen from other teams or in industry to drive continuous improvement of the team’s efficiency, speed, and quality

  • The candidate will also take responsibility for creating design specifications, unit testing, and preparing technical documentation.


About you:

  • Strong problem solving and analytic skill Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments simultaneously and effectively in a cross-functional team environment

  • Ability to work independently and in Agile teams. Scrum Team Member attitude – willingness to support the Team to be successful in any area necessary

  • A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or MIS.

  • 5-7 years of experience in software systems, programming, database development, and infrastructure development and administration

  • Minimum 5 years demonstrated experience with full stack development.

  • 3+ years demonstrated experience with AWS cloud supported programming languages like JavaScript, Node JS, React JS.

  • 2+ years hands-on with AWS Lambda, SNS/SQS, S3, IAM, CloudWatch, EC2, RDS and DynamoDB, AWS CLI

  • 2+ years hands-on building infrastructure as code using AWS CDK (Cloud Development Kit) and CloudFormation

  • Ability to use or learn: KMS, ALB/ELB, Route 53, VPC

  • Fluency with CI/CD toolsets such as: Jenkins, Ansible, CloudFormation, BitBucket

  • Working knowledge of AWS Serverless architecture

  • Working knowledge of distributed architectural design patterns

  • Strong and evolving competence in several programming languages and technologies, working knowledge of multiple tools sets, technologies and implementation environments


More About You:

  • Expertise in the knowledge of programming languages, relational databases, and NoSQL databases

  • Familiarity with monitoring tool suites like DataDog, SumoLogic, NewRelic, and Nagios

  • Experience with Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible in production environments

  • Strong practical Linux based systems administration skills and scripting experience in a Cloud based environment

  • Experience with automated testing tools (i.e. selenium, Cucumber) are a plus

  • Experience with Agile Scrum practice a plus

Software Developer & Database Systems Specialist


Position Overview:We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Developer and Database Systems Specialist to join our team at the Public Service Commission (PSC). The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and ensuring the smooth operation of our existing Document Management System (DMS) and Portal. This role requires expertise in ASP.NET, SQL Server, and JAVA, as well as strong proficiency in database management and system administration.

Responsibilities:

  1. SQL Server Database Maintenance:Perform all DMS-related SQL Server database maintenance tasks, including backups, corruption detection and fixing, index rebuilding, and management of data and transaction log files.
    Monitor and maintain system services to optimize performance and ensure data integrity.

  2. Cloud Migration:Collaborate with the PSC IT Division to migrate on-premise servers to cloud-based servers.
    Ensure seamless functionality of the DMS and Portal on the latest cloud-based platforms.

  3. Software Development:Design, develop, and deploy ASP.NET and JAVA code applications for online services such as e-filing, case and docket searches, public proceedings agendas, hearing schedules, and official filings.
    Implement coding updates, enhancements, and modifications to DMS functionality as specified by the PSC IT Division.

  4. Coordination and Collaboration:Coordinate with the PSC IT Division for updates, enhancements, and modifications to DMS functions.
    Work closely with other IT staff and designated cloud service providers to ensure smooth operation of the DMS.

Deliverables and Acceptance Criteria:

  1. DMS SQL Server Database Maintenance:Document all maintenance activities and provide weekly reports to the PSC IT Division.

  2. Cloud Migration:Ensure successful migration of the DMS to cloud-based servers, meeting acceptance criteria determined after consultation with the IT Division.

  3. Coordination and Code Implementation:Collaborate effectively with the IT Division for updates, enhancements, and modifications.
    Design, implement, test, and verify the operation of all code modifications and enhancements after migration to cloud-based servers.

Skills and Technologies Required:

  • Expertise in SQL Server database maintenance and administration on Windows Server.

  • Proficiency in ASP.NET and JAVA for designing and deploying online services applications.

  • Strong understanding of database management principles and system administration.

  • Experience with cloud migration projects and familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS).

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to troubleshoot database and system issues effectively.

  • Effective communication skills and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.

Additional Information:

  • This position will report to the Procurement Officer and Contract Monitor.

  • The successful candidate will interact with various IT staff as part of the maintenance agreement.

  • Normal office working facilities and equipment will be provided by the State, with any special requirements identified and addressed accordingly.

Note: The responsibilities outlined in this job description may evolve over time to meet the changing needs of the organization.

Summary

In this role, you’ll develop systems for handling new user registration and on boarding for large enterprise initiatives and support production releases that impact millions of users.


In this role, you will:

  • Collaborate on software projects with product design and technical teams

  • Develop, test, release, and maintain back-end services, front-end applications, and infrastructure

  • Work as a technical contributor on an Agile team

Qualifications needed for the role:

  • BA/BS required (major in an analytical field desired)

  • A minimum of 5 years’ work related experience

  • Advanced experience working with Node.js in an AWS environment. Intermediate experience with React, and relational databases like PostgreSQL, or noSQL (such asDynamoDB)

  • Experienced implementing serverless applications on AWS

  • Experience in hands-on development of software applications in a highly scaled environment

  • Experience working on Agile engineering teams

Preferred skills:

  • Ability to perform in multiple roles on a team, including testing and production support as well as development

  • Strong analytical thinking and structured problem-solving ability

  • Experience using libraries and frameworks where it makes sense, while still understanding how each line in your codebase works

  • Willingness to work on QA and develop test automation scripts and participate in code reviews

  • Ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively in a cross-functional team environment

  • Ethos of continuous improvement and interest in learning new things

  • Strong ability to understand and internalize the big picture and broader implications

  • Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skill with the ability to work with a diverse set of colleagues, across functions, from different organizations, disciplines, etc.

  • Self-starter, ability to set priorities, work independently and attain goals

  • AWS Certified (Associate or higher)

In this role, you will:

Project Management:

  • Create and manage integrated project schedules for the Customer Engagement team.

  • Support project planning among Customer Engagement workstreams, providing key insights from cross-team stakeholders, including scheduling and resource requirements.

  • Define, plan, and oversee tasks for immediate and long-term implementation.

  • Perform overall project risk and issue management, documenting mitigation strategies and status.

  • Collaborate with leaders across operations to identify impacts to Customer Engagement and create/maintain schedules.

  • Manage project communications including providing formal and informal status to stakeholders within and outside the Customer Engagement team.

  • Collaborate with team leads to document and track progress on continuous improvement initiatives Support team leads by maintaining team reports, tracking implementation activities.

  • Translate program requirements into project plans.

Meeting Management

  • Coordinate essential project meetings or working sessions, maintain meeting notes, and action item tracking.

  • Facilitate meetings and communicate formally and informally with stakeholders to drive agenda and encourage conclusions.

  • Identify project requirements and tasks as defined during working sessions.

  • Organize, update, and maintain information repositories including project documentation, master schedules, collaboration tools, and tactical information.

About You

  • 5-8 years of experience in project management.

  • A customer-centered, service-oriented attitude.

  • Experience with Smartsheet, and MS Office tools with the flexibility to leverage the best tool for each opportunity.

  • Demonstrated experience as an informal leader with a track record of gaining confidence and trust of new teams.

  • Demonstrated communication and decision-making skills.

  • Capability to plan large and complex cross-functional projects with a high degree of collaboration and a focus on timely delivery.

  • Excellent oral and written communications skills and presentation skills.

  • A collaborative focus with the ability to influence others and build strong professional relationships.

  • Experience with call centers, customer service and knowledge management for call center agents (a plus).

Job Description:

About the Role

The College Board is looking for a talented Senior UI/Visual Designer to support the College Readiness Assessment (CRA). You will work closely across dependent product teams, along with our design and engineering leads, to create user-friendly designs, UI components, interactions, and templates that will be used to support the end-to-end student and educator experiences.

You will also work closely with fellow design team members, product leads, and engineering partners to conceptualize, ideate, design, and deliver creative solutions that achieve business goals and serve user needs.

You will learn our existing global design system and help build off of it. You will also contribute to the dependent product teams for CRA (like our Digital Assessment Platforms), and working across channels to help reach and support our audience in a consistent way.

What you’ll do

  • Designing engaging experiences through compelling UI/visual design, leveraging our design standards, patterns and UI elements

  • Advocate for design process, methods, core system, and patterns in order to scale, educate, and evangelize consistency and best practices

  • Build out assets of core components of the CRA design system so that the CRA team can leverage those assets in design software like Figma

  • Working with the development team, clearly document the standards of the design system in a user-friendly way

  • Use an iterative process, working closely with UX design and engineering counterparts to design, prototype, and validate design ideas

  • Contribute to the overall visual and UI strategy for the CRA product design, partnering closely with the discipline teams to define a design system to facilitate a unified experience across all of our products

  • Responsive to direction and comfortable working with multiple people from different disciplines to achieve an impactful experience

  • Be a significant contributor to the fostering of our design process and quality standards based on objective, data-driven evidence

  • Document and present system updates to stakeholders and users

  • Work collaboratively with our Design System team to ensure brand and pattern alignment

  • Foster a collaborative and learning environment

  • Nurture a culture of user empathy and deep curiosity that enables us to build simple, intuitive products for our customers

Qualifications

  • Ability to generate and successfully apply product-specific visual ideas grounded in strong UX

  • Advanced understanding of design systems, hierarchy, typography, visual design, data visualization, responsiveness, branding, illustration, iconography and interaction design

  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to present ideas effectively—both verbally and visually

  • Ability to work autonomously, manage multiple tasks with accuracy and attention to schedules, and communicate progress

  • Understanding of user experience fundamentals, and their impact on UI and interaction design

  • Experience working within a distributed design team - collaborating with designers on different product teams to create and ideate

  • Constantly think about usability, accessibility, responsiveness and other properties through design execution

  • Must be comfortable designing/prototyping in Figma (med-high fidelity)

  • Have experience in design annotation and specs

  • Designed large-scale, complex enterprise applications in an iterative environment

  • 5-7 years design experience

  • Figma/Principle/Adobe

Your Impact

  • Comfortable leading design on projects, both as an individual contributor and in collaboration with other designers

  • Able to translate art direction and feedback into better design solutions

  • Self-managing but also used to working within a team

  • Someone with experience working in agile, iterative design and delivery environments

  • Effective, but easy-going – someone that is fun to work with and really thrives in a collaborative environment

  • A person with a good sense of humor who isn’t afraid to try and fail (or to try and succeed)

  • Able to provide relevant design case studies and a portfolio of your work

Mode: Long-Term


About the Team

The Design team is a close-knit group of about 30 members with a passion for helping students plan for their future. The UX Research discipline at College Board performs, advocates for, teaches and supports user research. This research informs and validates our strategies and designs leading to the best users’ experience with our products and brand.

UX Research works with all major portfolios across College Board including SAT Suite of Assessments, Advanced Placement, and BigFuture.

UX Research at College Board is a small team who performs user research, advocates for users, and supports team members by teaching them to conduct their own research. Our research informs and validates design work across College Board, leading to better user experiences for the students and educators who interact with our products.

About the Role

The College Board is seeking a Senior UX Researcher to join a small, collaborative UX Research team. As a Senior UX Researcher, you will lead UX Research initiatives and support design discovery and product improvements across multiple touch points and experiences across product portfolios. You will partner with the business and engineering teams to prioritize UX research activities throughout the software development lifecycle by working closely with our program owners to understand their needs and help the team find solutions that serve user needs and achieve business goals.

As a Senior UX Researcher, you will also contribute to the internal UX Research team by helping to define processes that enable product teams to center the user. In this role you will be integral in helping product teams design easy to use products for students and educators.

In this role, you will:

Strategy & Research for Product Development (60%)

  • Identify target users and help build hypotheses around user needs for projects

  • Plan, develop, own and lead research (generative and evaluative) for your team/products

  • Contribute to product roadmaps and help prioritize features based on data

  • In addition to research, collect other types of data to inform design decisions/solutions (e.g., surveys, analytics dashboards, accessibility reviews)

  • Lead synthesis sessions with your team, following agile and lean methodologies

  • Create artifacts to share out UX Research synthesis and decisions and present research result to stakeholders

  • Create user journeys and flows to capture current and future states of user pathways to influence planning of MVPs and prospective releases

Contribute to Internal Research Processes (30%)

  • Collaborate with the team to promote communication and synchronicity in planning and centering the user in the product development process

  • Contribute to the overall research strategy for our product designs, including refining research team processes and research templates

  • Coach designers and other product team members on incorporating, advocating for and completing UX Research activities to inform and prioritize work

  • Nurture a culture of user empathy and deep curiosity that enables us to build simple, intuitive products for our customers

  • Advocate for consistent design processes, methods, core systems, and patterns

Project Management (10%)

  • Self-manage workload and obtain necessary requirements and acceptance criteria needed to complete work

  • Coordinate with UX Lead, product leads, design team, and engineers to ensure timely delivery of research artifacts

  • Help foster an environment for collaboration by partnering with business and other creative units to align our visual design approach with project goals, and the College Board brand

About You

  • As a user experience researcher, you are independent in your support of a cross-functional team.

  • A portfolio of your work is included in your application that shows examples of your experience leading user research initiatives.

  • You have a bachelor’s degree in a related field (computer science, interaction design, HCI, industrial design, information science, social sciences, etc.) and/or equivalent years of work experience.

  • You have 5+ years of professional experience of relevant UX Research experience—including experience performing moderated user interviews or usability tests and experience performing at least some of the following: unmoderated usability testing, card sorts, web analytics data analysis, A/B testing, survey creation and analysis, cognitive walk-throughs and heuristic analysis.

  • You have experience presenting and delivering research findings to product teams and to stakeholders in a variety of appropriate formats for actionable results.

  • You have documented experience in researching for large, content-rich websites and/or applications; proven outcomes that impacted users’ needs.

  • You hold a broad knowledge of digital products, web site architecture, user interfaces, and navigation on various platforms (Web, mobile, tablet).

  • You have experience guiding and teaching designers and other team members to complete basic research activities.

  • You have experience contributing to the simplification of research processes.

  • You understand the physical, cognitive, cultural, and social factors that affect design decisions.

  • You’re a strong communicator with an ability to demonstrate both leadership and understanding with respect to project partners; self-managing, but also used to working within a team.

  • You’re highly adaptable to new information, situations, or challenges and can work independently.

  • You like facing new challenges and thrive on opportunities to think creatively and come up with fresh approaches to tough business and operational problems.

  • You possess a ‘Product Design’ mindset, who owns the end-to-end design delivery: from strategy to validation of designs in process to establishing and collecting metrics.
